fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.tiko2a

Class Drawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
      • fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.tiko2a.Drawing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class Drawing
extends com.badlogic.gdx.InputAdapter
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    This class handles rendering what the player draws, the objective circles, checking if player is drawing close enough to the lines and checking if the player has cleared the obstacle.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2[][] array2D
      2D Vector2 Array in which all the seperate points arraylists are saved to, every time touchUp is called.

      Variable used to determine the size of the small circles rendered on the screen

      Images used by this class

      Instance of BundleHandler that is used to manage all the assets.

      Helper variable used to place the top banner into the spot on the screen.

      The point where the player touches the screen.

      Helper variable that is used to check if the current drawing is the first shape the player is drawing or not.

      The next point after finger has been dragged.

      Boolean that is used to check if the distance of the player drawn line is OK.

      Helper variable used to change the width of the line that player draws

      Array of TiledMap point objects used to determine where player should (is able) to draw.

      Helper variable used to determine the maximum distance the player can draw away from the desired line.

      Helper variable used to check if player has dragged their finger on the screen

      The next point coordinate X (when player has dragged their finger on the screen)

      The next point coordinate Y (when player has dragged their finger on the screen)
      (package private) java.util.List<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> points
      ArrayList in which all the points of one drawing are collected to, meaning all the points between each toucDown and touchUp.

      An ExtendViewport used to position the cameras correctly ExtendViewport
      private java.lang.Boolean shouldRender
      Helper variable used to prevent the update() method from creating multiple new screen instances when the obstacle has been cleared.

      ShapeRenderer used to render the lines and circles ShapeRenderer

      First point coordinate X (where player starts drawing)

      Renderer used to render the TiledMap TiledMapRenderer

      Helper variable used to check if the screen has been touched
      private int tracker
      Tracker that is used to place the "points" array into the next slot of the 2D array.
      private float winDistance
      Variable to determine the minimum distance between player drawn line and the ellipses.

      • resetDrawing

        public void resetDrawing()
        This method is used to reset the all the drawings the player has made.

      • checkDistanceToLinePoints

        public boolean checkDistanceToLinePoints(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 point)
        This method is used to check if the player is drawing close enough to the desired line. Uses Vector2 dst() method for calculating the distance.
        Parameters:
        point - Players inputPoint that is checked against the mapPointObjects for the distance
        Returns:
        true if the distance is below or equal to maxDistance, false if not.

      • checkWinEllipsesForVisit

        public boolean checkWinEllipsesForVisit(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 point)
        This method is used to check if player has visited (drawn close enough to) an ellipse. Uses Vector2 dst() method for calculating the distance.
        Parameters:
        point - Players inputPoint that is checked against the ellipseArray (ellipse positions) for the distance.
        Returns:
        false if not all ellipses have been visited, true if all of them have.

      • tiledMapPointsToArray

        public void tiledMapPointsToArray(java.lang.String layername,
                                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2> targetArray)
        This method is used to translate the positions of the TiledMap point objects into the desired Vector2 targetArray.
        Parameters:
        layername - The name of the layer taht holds the desired objects in the map
        targetArray - The Vector2 targetArray that will contain the positions

      • tiledMapEllipsesToArray

        public void tiledMapEllipsesToArray(java.lang.String layername,
                                    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Ellipse> targetArray)
        This method is used to translate the TiledMap ellipse objects into ellipses that are saved in the targetArray of ellipses.
        Parameters:
        layername - The name of the layer that holds the desired objects in the map
        targetArray - The Ellipse targetArray that will contain the ellipses

      • drawLines

        private void drawLines()
        This method is used to render the lines between drawn points and to render the ellipses.

        This method is used to render the ellipses.
